alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 5:27PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Elbert, eastern Hart, south central Greenville, Anderson and west central Abbeville Counties through 600 PM EST... At 527 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Hartwell to 10 miles west of Elberton. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Elberton, Hartwell, Homeland Park, Belton, Williamston, Northlake, Iva, Lake Secession and West Pelzer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for northeastern Georgia...and Upstate South Carolina.
